CVE-2025-1744(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-28T06:30:54

1 posts

Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in radareorg radare2 allows heap-based buffer over-read or buffer overflow.This issue affects radare2: before <5.9.9.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-28T13:28:05.000Z ##

I like radare2, and I like perfect 10 CVEs. Not sure I like them together though. It does highlight that supply chain risk is hard to track, especially when a library like zlib is cloned rather than used as a dependency.

https://github.com/radareorg/radare2/pull/23969

sev:CRIT 10.0 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H

Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in radareorg radare2 allows heap-based buffer over-read or buffer overflow.This issue affects radare2: before <5.9.9.

This PR fixes a security vulnerability in inflate() that was cloned from zlib but did not receive the security patch applied in zlib. The original issue was reported and fixed under madler/zlib@eff308a.

This PR applies the same patch as the one in zlib to eliminate the vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1744

CVE-2025-27399
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-27T18:15:30.380000

2 posts

Mastodon is a self-hosted, federated microblogging platform. In versions prior to 4.1.23, 4.2.16, and 4.3.4, when the visibility for domain blocks/reasons is set to "users" (localized English string: "To logged-in users"), users that are not yet approved can view the block reasons. Instance admins that do not want their domain blocks to be public are impacted. Versions 4.1.23, 4.2.16, and 4.3.4 fi

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-27T18:18:43.000Z ##

Mastodon CVEs, but nothing critical.

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-v39f-c9jj-8w7h

Mastodon is a self-hosted, federated microblogging platform. Starting in version 4.2.0 and prior to versions 4.2.16 and 4.3.4, the rate limits are missing on /auth/setup. Without those rate limits, an attacker can craft requests that will send an email to an arbitrary addresses. Versions 4.2.16 and 4.3.4 fix the issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27157

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-94h4-fj37-c825

Mastodon is a self-hosted, federated microblogging platform. In versions prior to 4.1.23, 4.2.16, and 4.3.4, when the visibility for domain blocks/reasons is set to "users" (localized English string: "To logged-in users"), users that are not yet approved can view the block reasons. Instance admins that do not want their domain blocks to be public are impacted. Versions 4.1.23, 4.2.16, and 4.3.4 fix the issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27399

(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-27T17:15:16.867000

1 posts

Mastodon is a self-hosted, federated microblogging platform. Starting in version 4.2.0 and prior to versions 4.2.16 and 4.3.4, the rate limits are missing on `/auth/setup`. Without those rate limits, an attacker can craft requests that will send an email to an arbitrary addresses. Versions 4.2.16 and 4.3.4 fix the issue.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-27T18:18:43.000Z ##

Mastodon CVEs, but nothing critical.

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-v39f-c9jj-8w7h

Mastodon is a self-hosted, federated microblogging platform. Starting in version 4.2.0 and prior to versions 4.2.16 and 4.3.4, the rate limits are missing on /auth/setup. Without those rate limits, an attacker can craft requests that will send an email to an arbitrary addresses. Versions 4.2.16 and 4.3.4 fix the issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27157

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-94h4-fj37-c825

Mastodon is a self-hosted, federated microblogging platform. In versions prior to 4.1.23, 4.2.16, and 4.3.4, when the visibility for domain blocks/reasons is set to "users" (localized English string: "To logged-in users"), users that are not yet approved can view the block reasons. Instance admins that do not want their domain blocks to be public are impacted. Versions 4.1.23, 4.2.16, and 4.3.4 fix the issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27399

##

CVE-2024-54169
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-02-27T15:32:00

1 posts

IBM EntireX 11.1 could allow an authenticated attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system.

updated 2025-02-26T21:30:38

1 posts

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android app V2.1.6.20241017 and prior uses an insecure AES key to encrypt client data (insufficient entropy). This may allow attackers to decrypt intercepted communications between the mobile app and iSolarCloud.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T21:53:39.000Z ##

I don't know Sungrow but I know there are a bunch of #solarPunk nerds on here so maybe they would be interested in the 9 CVEs that were just published for their products.

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6126

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android app V2.1.6.20241017 and prior uses an insecure AES key to encrypt client data (insufficient entropy). This may allow attackers to decrypt intercepted communications between the mobile app and iSolarCloud.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50684

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6140

SunGrow WiNet-S V200.001.00.P025 and earlier versions is missing integrity checks for firmware upgrades. Sending a specific MQTT message allows an update to an inverter or a WiNet connectivity dongle with a bogus firmware file that is located on attacker-controlled server.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50696

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6120

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the userService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50693

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6124

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android app V2.1.6.20241104 and prior suffers from Missing SSL Certificate Validation. The app explicitly ignores certificate errors and is vulnerable to MiTM attacks. Attackers can impersonate the iSolarCloud server and communicate with the Android app.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50691

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6116

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the orgService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50689

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6122

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android application V2.1.6.20241017 and prior contains hardcoded credentials. The application (regardless of the user account) and the cloud uses the same MQTT credentials for exchanging the device telemetry.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50688

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6114

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the devService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50687

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6112

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the commonService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50686

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6118

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation, is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the powerStationService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50685

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-0731 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-0731/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_0731

##

CVE-2024-30150
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-26T00:32:27

1 posts

HCL MyCloud is affected by Improper Access Control - an unauthenticated privilege escalation vulnerability which may lead to information disclosure and potential for Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) and Denial of Service(DOS) attacks from unauthenticated users.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-25T23:16:18.000Z ##

HCL MyCloud has a PrivEsc vuln that leads to SSRF and DoS, but based on the CVSS I don't expect it's going to be urgently patched. Even though it says it's an unauthenticated SSRF. I assume that means that the impacted part of the server does not contain anything sensitive because we know that a vendor wouldn't sandbag their own CVE, right?

sev:MED 5.3 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N

https://support.hcl-software.com/csm?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0119368

HCL MyCloud is affected by Improper Access Control - an unauthenticated privilege escalation vulnerability which may lead to information disclosure and potential for Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) and Denial of Service(DOS) attacks from unauthenticated users.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-30150

And the fact that this is the first thing I saw on their website makes me want all their shit to get hacked.

##

CVE-2025-0514(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-26T00:32:22

1 posts

Improper Input Validation vulnerability in The Document Foundation LibreOffice allows Windows Executable hyperlink targets to be executed unconditionally on activation.This issue affects LibreOffice: from 24.8 before < 24.8.5.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-25T22:10:00.000Z ##

Does anyone even use LibreOffice on Windows? If so, maybe patch it. Basically, if someone tried to follow a hyperlink in a doc but if it's an exe instead of a URL link, it may execute before the user realizes what's up.

https://www.libreoffice.org/about-us/security/advisories/cve-2025-0514

Improper Input Validation vulnerability in The Document Foundation LibreOffice allows Windows Executable hyperlink targets to be executed unconditionally on activation.This issue affects LibreOffice: from 24.8 before < 24.8.5.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0514

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-25T21:31:43

1 posts

##

CVE-2025-26598
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

An out-of-bounds write flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The function GetBarrierDevice() searches for the pointer device based on its device ID and returns the matching value, or supposedly NULL, if no match was found. However, the code will return the last element of the list if no matching device ID is found, which can lead to out-of-bounds memory access.

stefano@bsd.cafe at 2025-02-26T07:26:45.000Z ##

OpenBSD: 009: SECURITY FIX: February 25, 2025

Multiple X server issues. CVE-2025-26594
CVE-2025-26595 CVE-2025-26596 CVE-2025-26597 CVE-2025-26598 CVE-2025-26599 CVE-2025-26600 CVE-2025-26601

https://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/7.6/common/009_xserver.patch.sig

##

CVE-2025-26595
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

A buffer overflow flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The code in XkbVModMaskText() allocates a fixed-sized buffer on the stack and copies the names of the virtual modifiers to that buffer. The code fails to check the bounds of the buffer and would copy the data regardless of the size.

stefano@bsd.cafe at 2025-02-26T07:26:45.000Z ##

##

CVE-2025-26601
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

A use-after-free flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. When changing an alarm, the values of the change mask are evaluated one after the other, changing the trigger values as requested, and eventually, SyncInitTrigger() is called. If one of the changes triggers an error, the function will return early, not adding the new sync object, possibly causing a use-after-free when the alarm eventually trig

stefano@bsd.cafe at 2025-02-26T07:26:45.000Z ##

##

CVE-2025-26594
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

A use-after-free flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The root cursor is referenced in the X server as a global variable. If a client frees the root cursor, the internal reference points to freed memory and causes a use-after-free.

stefano@bsd.cafe at 2025-02-26T07:26:45.000Z ##

OpenBSD: 009: SECURITY FIX: February 25, 2025

Multiple X server issues. CVE-2025-26594

##

CVE-2025-26599
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

An access to an uninitialized pointer flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The function compCheckRedirect() may fail if it cannot allocate the backing pixmap. In that case, compRedirectWindow() will return a BadAlloc error without validating the window tree marked just before, which leaves the validated data partly initialized and the use of an uninitialized pointer later.

stefano@bsd.cafe at 2025-02-26T07:26:45.000Z ##

##

CVE-2025-26600
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

A use-after-free flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. When a device is removed while still frozen, the events queued for that device remain while the device is freed. Replaying the events will cause a use-after-free.

stefano@bsd.cafe at 2025-02-26T07:26:45.000Z ##

##

CVE-2023-25574
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-25T17:48:35

1 posts

### Impact Only users that has configured a JupyterHub installation to use the authenticator class `LTI13Authenticator` are influenced. LTI13Authenticator that was introduced in `jupyterhub-ltiauthenticator` 1.3.0 wasn't validating JWT signatures. This is believed to allow the LTI13Authenticator to authorize a forged request granting access to existing and new user identities. ### Patches None

DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-25T15:28:44.000Z ##

🚨CVE-2023-25574: LTI13Authenticator: JWT signature not validated

CVSS: 10

https://darkwebinformer.com/cve-2023-25574-lti13authenticator-jwt-signature-not-validated/

CVE-2017-3066
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.07%

updated 2025-02-25T02:00:02.097000

4 posts

Adobe ColdFusion 2016 Update 3 and earlier, ColdFusion 11 update 11 and earlier, ColdFusion 10 Update 22 and earlier have a Java deserialization vulnerability in the Apache BlazeDS library. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution.

CVE-2025-27364
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-24T21:31:44

5 posts

In MITRE Caldera through 4.2.0 and 5.0.0 before 35bc06e, a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability was found in the dynamic agent (implant) compilation functionality of the server. This allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server that Caldera is running on via a crafted web request to the Caldera server API used for compiling and downloading of Caldera's Sandcat or Manx agent

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T19:39:56.000Z ##

A perfect 10 in MITRE Caldera? Nice. 🥳

https://medium.com/@mitrecaldera/mitre-caldera-security-advisory-remote-code-execution-cve-2025-27364-5f679e2e2a0e

In MITRE Caldera through 4.2.0 and 5.0.0 before 35bc06e, a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability was found in the dynamic agent (implant) compilation functionality of the server. This allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server that Caldera is running on via a crafted web request to the Caldera server API used for compiling and downloading of Caldera's Sandcat or Manx agent (implants). This web request can use the gcc -extldflags linker flag with sub-commands.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27364

##

CVE-2025-22495
(8.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-24T18:32:48

1 posts

An improper input validation vulnerability was discovered in the NTP server configuration field of the Network-M2 card. This could result in an authenticated high privileged user having the ability to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability has been resolved in the version 3.0.4. Note - Network-M2 has been declared end-of-life in early 2024 and Network-M3 has been released as a fit-and-func

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T17:33:56.000Z ##

I love NTP vulns for reasons and a forever-day is even better. Granted, this one appears to be post-auth, but given where Eaton devices tend to be used, it might be a good one to keep in the back pocket.

sev:HIGH 8.4 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

https://www.eaton.com/content/dam/eaton/company/news-insights/cybersecurity/security-bulletins/etn-va-2025-1004.pdf

An improper input validation vulnerability was discovered in the NTP server configuration field of the Network-M2 card. This could result in an authenticated high privileged user having the ability to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability has been resolved in the version 3.0.4. Note - Network-M2 has been declared end-of-life in early 2024 and Network-M3 has been released as a fit-and-functional replacement.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22495

##

CVE-2025-20051
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-24T18:28:23

2 posts

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate input when patching and duplicating a board, which allows a user to read any arbitrary file on the system via duplicating a specially crafted block in Boards.

DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T17:38:10.000Z ##

https://darkwebinformer.com/cve-2025-20051-24490-25279-mattermost-boards-arbitrary-file-read-vulnerability-in-multiple-versions/

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T15:18:33.000Z ##

Mattermost released a security advisory last week but there are no details besides the CVEs.

https://mattermost.com/security-updates/

Details on the security update will be posted here on March 21 as per our Responsible Disclosure Policy.

So here are some descriptions on the three sev:CRIT vulns I see:

sev:CRIT 9.6 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:N

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to use prepared statements in the SQL query of boards reordering which allows an attacker to retrieve data from the database, via a SQL injection when reordering specially crafted boards categories.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-24490

sev:CRIT 9.9 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate input when patching and duplicating a board, which allows a user to read any arbitrary file on the system via duplicating a specially crafted block in Boards.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-20051

sev:CRIT 9.9 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate board blocks when importing boards which allows an attacker could read any arbitrary file on the system via importing and exporting a specially crafted import archive in Boards.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-25279

##

CVE-2025-1632
(3.3 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-24T15:30:49

1 posts

A vulnerability was found in libarchive up to 3.7.7. It has been classified as problematic. This affects the function list of the file bsdunzip.c. The manipulation leads to null pointer dereference. It is possible to launch the attack on the local host. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T15:13:43.000Z ##

Apparently there's a null pointer dereference vuln in libarchive up to 3.7.7 that has been ignored by the vendor. There's a supposed PoC zip file published but I don't have the time or fucks to dig into it right now.

https://github.com/Ekkosun/pocs/blob/main/bsdunzip-poc

A vulnerability was found in libarchive up to 3.7.7. It has been classified as problematic. This affects the function list of the file bsdunzip.c. The manipulation leads to null pointer dereference. It is possible to launch the attack on the local host. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1632

The restore endpoint of binance-trading-bot is vulnerable to command injection via the `/restore` endpoint. The name of the uploaded file is passe

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T22:18:57.000Z ##

Post-auth command injection in binance-trading-bot. I don't imagine it directly impact most people's jobs but anything to disrupt the cryptocurrency scam market is cool with me.

sev:HIGH 7.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

https://github.com/chrisleekr/binance-trading-bot/security/advisories/GHSA-wq6j-4388-4gg5

binance-trading-bot is an automated Binance trading bot with trailing buy/sell strategy. Authenticated users of binance-trading-bot can achieve Remote Code Execution on the host system due to a command injection vulnerability in the /restore endpoint. The restore endpoint of binance-trading-bot is vulnerable to command injection via the /restore endpoint. The name of the uploaded file is passed to shell.exec without sanitization other than path normalization, resulting in Remote Code Execution. This may allow any authorized user to execute code in the context of the host machine. This issue has been addressed in version 0.0.100 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27106

Product: PostgreSQL
CVSS: High (8.1)

A vulnerability in PostgreSQL's libpq functions and command-line utilities allows SQL injection under specific conditions. Exploitation requires constructing input for psql, the PostgreSQL interactive terminal, or using certain character encoding.

A vulnerability was found in OpenSSH when the VerifyHostKeyDNS option is enabled. A machine-in-the-middle attack can be performed by a malicious machine impersonating a legit server. This issue occurs due to how OpenSSH mishandles error codes in specific conditions when verifying the host key. For an attack to be considered successful, the attacker needs to manage to exhaust the client's memory re

kpwn@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T13:07:02.000Z ##

Rank 4: CVE-2025-26465
Product: OpenSSH

A vulnerability in OpenSSH, triggered when the VerifyHostKeyDNS option is enabled, allows a machine-in-the-middle attack by a malicious server impersonating a legitimate one. The flaw stems from mishandled error codes during host key verification. However, the attack requires exhausting the client’s memory first, making it complex to execute.

CVE-2022-35202
(5.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-13T18:33:33

1 posts

A security issue in Sitevision version 10.3.1 and older allows a remote attacker, in certain (non-default) scenarios, to gain access to the private keys used for signing SAML Authn requests. The underlying issue is a Java keystore that may become accessible and downloadable via WebDAV. This keystore is protected with a low-complexity, auto-generated password.

CVE-2024-53197(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-27T15:32:03

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA: usb-audio: Fix potential out-of-bound accesses for Extigy and Mbox devices A bogus device can provide a bNumConfigurations value that exceeds the initial value used in usb_get_configuration for allocating dev->config. This can lead to out-of-bounds accesses later, e.g. in usb_destroy_configuration.

0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-28T19:10:02.000Z ##

Whoa, Cellebrite used a zero-day exploit against Android? Seriously? And get this - it was against an activist. As a pentester, I've gotta say, that's seriously messed up. Zero-days are like, the holy grail of vulnerabilities. The vendor's clueless, and attackers? They've got a free pass.

So, jot down these CVE numbers: CVE-2024-53104, CVE-2024-53197, CVE-2024-50302. This just goes to show you how crucial those updates really are! And let's be real, USB ports? Total risk factor.

Makes you wonder, doesn't it? How secure are our phones *really*? And hey, what steps do *you* take to stay protected? Let's chat about it.

#security #pentest #android

Dieser Umstand verdeutlicht einmal mehr, wie wichtig es ist, von derartigen Sicherheitsfunktionen Gebrauch zu machen."

##

CVE-2024-53104
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-12-11T15:32:23

3 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media: uvcvideo: Skip parsing frames of type UVC_VS_UNDEFINED in uvc_parse_format This can lead to out of bounds writes since frames of this type were not taken into account when calculating the size of the frames buffer in uvc_parse_streaming.

kpwn@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T13:07:02.000Z ##

Rank 5: CVE-2024-53104
Product: Linux kernel's USB Video Class (UVC) driver
Known Exploited Vulnerability

A flaw in uvc_parse_format allows UVC_VS_UNDEFINED frames to be parsed, leading to out-of-bounds writes because their size wasn't considered when allocating the frame buffer in uvc_parse_streaming. The fix skips parsing these frames to prevent memory corruption.

Post by @GrapheneOS:
https://grapheneos.social/@GrapheneOS/113943808951328642

#CveCrowdDeny

xairy@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-28T15:50:23.000Z ##

For CVE-2024-53104 (OOB write in uvc_parse_format), syzbot reaches uvc_parse_streaming — parent function of uvc_parse_format — but fails to get to the bug: syzkaller has no descriptions for streaming interface descriptors.

https://storage.googleapis.com/syzbot-assets/7efefb59364f/ci2-upstream-usb-c749f058.html#drivers%2fmedia%2fusb%2fuvc%2fuvc_driver.c

CVE-2024-50302
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-11-27T15:32:50

11 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: HID: core: zero-initialize the report buffer Since the report buffer is used by all kinds of drivers in various ways, let's zero-initialize it during allocation to make sure that it can't be ever used to leak kernel memory via specially-crafted report.

CVE-2024-43093 and CVE-2024-50302.

Security Week: Google Patches Pair of Exploited Vulnerabilities in Android https://www.securityweek.com/google-patches-pair-of-exploited-vulnerabilities-in-android/ @SecurityWeek #Google #Android #cybersecurity #infosec

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T05:11:09.000Z ##

Hey Android folks, listen up! 👀 Google just dropped a crucial security update that you seriously need to check out. It might just be relevant to your phone. Word on the street is, two of the patched vulnerabilities are already being exploited in the wild. Crazy, right? 😬

This reminds me of those chats I have with clients: "So, Android's secure, yeah?" Well... Privilege Escalation basically means an attacker can snag more permissions on your device. In short: hackers can potentially grab your data! 😱

They've squashed a whopping 44 vulnerabilities in this March update. CVE-2024-43093 & CVE-2024-50302 are seriously critical. Apparently, CVE-2024-50302 was even leveraged by Cellebrite to get into an activist's phone. Wild stuff! 😳

Go ahead and check your Android version and smash that update button ASAP (look for 2025-03-01 or 2025-03-05)! Also, be extra careful with apps from sources you don't know. Regular security checks are a must, even on your smartphone.

Have you already installed the update? Any thoughts or experiences with Android security? 🤔

#AndroidSecurity #infosec #pentest

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-28T19:10:02.000Z ##

Makes you wonder, doesn't it? How secure are our phones *really*? And hey, what steps do *you* take to stay protected? Let's chat about it.

#security #pentest #android

##
xairy@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-28T15:50:57.000Z ##

Reaching code for CVE-2024-50302 (infoleak via Anton Touchpad) seems to require a bit more descriptions work: hid-multitouch.c is barely covered by syzbot. But the bug type is discoverable via KMSAN: it reports infoleaks over USB as kernel-usb-infoleak.

https://storage.googleapis.com/syzbot-assets/7efefb59364f/ci2-upstream-usb-c749f058.html#drivers%2fhid%2fhid-multitouch.c

##

CVE-2024-49035
(8.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 18.34%

updated 2024-11-26T21:32:31

5 posts

An improper access control vulnerability in Partner.Microsoft.com allows an a unauthenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-03-04T15:50:51.000Z ##

This is the partner.microsoft.com portal, it allows CSPs - Cloud Solution Providers - to gain access to their customer's environments.

CVE-2024-49035 was around improper privilege management, i.e. being able to access things you shouldn't.

It being in CISA KEV says it was being exploited in the wild.

That portal allows a huge footprint of access by design.

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-03-04T15:32:21.000Z ##

Not sure if anybody else caught this, but CISA added CVE-2024-49035 to KEV a week ago - that vuln is about partner.microsoft.com being owned.

Partner.microsoft.com is a portal which allows orgs to grant access to Microsoft 365 tenants, ie read data of downstream customers. #threatintel

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-03-04T15:50:51.000Z ##

This is the partner.microsoft.com portal, it allows CSPs - Cloud Solution Providers - to gain access to their customer's environments.

CVE-2024-49035 was around improper privilege management, i.e. being able to access things you shouldn't.

It being in CISA KEV says it was being exploited in the wild.

That portal allows a huge footprint of access by design.

##

CVE-2018-13313
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.15%

updated 2024-11-21T03:46:51.290000

1 posts

In TOTOLINK A3002RU 1.0.8, the router provides a page that allows the user to change their account name and password. This page, password.htm, contains JavaScript which is used to confirm the user knows their current password before allowing them to change their password. However, this JavaScript contains the current user’s password in plaintext.

CVE-2024-43093
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.25%

updated 2024-11-13T21:31:39

3 posts

In shouldHideDocument of ExternalStorageProvider.java, there is a possible bypass of a file path filter designed to prevent access to sensitive directories due to incorrect unicode normalization. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

Security Week: Google Patches Pair of Exploited Vulnerabilities in Android https://www.securityweek.com/google-patches-pair-of-exploited-vulnerabilities-in-android/ @SecurityWeek #Google #Android #cybersecurity #infosec

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T14:53:22.000Z ##

CVE-2024-43093 and CVE-2024-50302.

Security Week: Google Patches Pair of Exploited Vulnerabilities in Android https://www.securityweek.com/google-patches-pair-of-exploited-vulnerabilities-in-android/ @SecurityWeek #Google #Android #cybersecurity #infosec

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T05:11:09.000Z ##

Hey Android folks, listen up! 👀 Google just dropped a crucial security update that you seriously need to check out. It might just be relevant to your phone. Word on the street is, two of the patched vulnerabilities are already being exploited in the wild. Crazy, right? 😬

This reminds me of those chats I have with clients: "So, Android's secure, yeah?" Well... Privilege Escalation basically means an attacker can snag more permissions on your device. In short: hackers can potentially grab your data! 😱

They've squashed a whopping 44 vulnerabilities in this March update. CVE-2024-43093 & CVE-2024-50302 are seriously critical. Apparently, CVE-2024-50302 was even leveraged by Cellebrite to get into an activist's phone. Wild stuff! 😳

Go ahead and check your Android version and smash that update button ASAP (look for 2025-03-01 or 2025-03-05)! Also, be extra careful with apps from sources you don't know. Regular security checks are a must, even on your smartphone.

Have you already installed the update? Any thoughts or experiences with Android security? 🤔

#AndroidSecurity #infosec #pentest

CVE-2023-38408
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 4.40%

updated 2024-04-19T05:07:56

1 posts

The PKCS#11 feature in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.3p2 has an insufficiently trustworthy search path, leading to remote code execution if an agent is forwarded to an attacker-controlled system. (Code in /usr/lib is not necessarily safe for loading into ssh-agent.) NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-10009.

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T07:19:27.000Z ##

Okay folks, the new CISA KEV list is out... and wow, there are some serious vulnerabilities on it this time! 💥 Especially CVE-2023-20118 – looks like Cisco routers are in the crosshairs. Sadly, those routers are often the very first thing attackers go after. 🎯 So, definitely take a look and see if you are affected.

The big issue is, lots of people aren't patching their systems quickly enough. Then, they're shocked when something goes wrong! 💣 Think of the CISA KEV list as the "Most Wanted" list for exploits, ya know?

Seriously though, hands up: who's actually checked their router firmware lately? 🙋‍♂️ I wonder. #questionable

Remember, security isn't just about buying a product. It's an ongoing process! And hey, if you need a hand with any of this, you know where to find me. 😉

#cisa #infosec #pentesting

updated 2023-10-31T20:58:35

1 posts

CVE-2020-9493 identified a deserialization issue that was present in Apache Chainsaw. Prior to Chainsaw V2.0 Chainsaw was a component of Apache Log4j 1.2.x where the same issue exists. Users are advised to migrate from `log4j:log4j` to `org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j` for an updated version of the library.

##

CVE-2022-23305
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.36%

updated 2023-10-31T20:57:34

1 posts

By design, the JDBCAppender in Log4j 1.2.x accepts an SQL statement as a configuration parameter where the values to be inserted are converters from PatternLayout. The message converter, %m, is likely to always be included. This allows attackers to manipulate the SQL by entering crafted strings into input fields or headers of an application that are logged allowing unintended SQL queries to be exe

https://github.com/logpresso/CVE-2021-44228-Scanner

https://github.com/AlphabugX/CVE-2022-RCE

https://github.com/tkomlodi/CVE-2022-23305_POC

https://github.com/HynekPetrak/log4shell-finder

##

CVE-2019-17571
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.85%

updated 2023-10-12T20:41:02

1 posts

Included in Log4j 1.2 is a SocketServer class that is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted data which can be exploited to remotely execute arbitrary code when combined with a deserialization gadget when listening to untrusted network traffic for log data. This affects Log4j versions 1.2 up to 1.2.17. Users are advised to migrate to `org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-core`.

4 repos

https://github.com/hillu/local-log4j-vuln-scanner

https://github.com/Al1ex/CVE-2019-17571

https://github.com/shadow-horse/CVE-2019-17571

https://github.com/HynekPetrak/log4shell-finder

Ob ihr komplett den Verstand verloren habt, habe ich gefragt!

updated 2023-02-02T05:02:20

3 posts

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows when the Win32k component fails to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability." This affects Windows 7, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows RT 8.1, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2012, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 10, Windows 10 Servers. ##

CVE-2025-27501
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T19:46:06.000Z ##

OpenZiti sounds delicious and can't be trusted. Which is good(?) for a zero-trust project.

https://github.com/openziti/ziti-console/security/advisories/GHSA-frxm-vm48-5qf2

OpenZiti is a free and open source project focused on bringing zero trust to any application. An endpoint(/api/upload) on the admin panel can be accessed without any form of authentication. This endpoint accepts an HTTP POST to upload a file which is then stored on the node and is available via URL. This can lead to a stored cross site scripting attack if the file uploaded contains malicious code and is then accessed and executed within the context of the user's browser. This function is no longer necessary as the ziti-console moves from a node server application to a single page application, and has been disabled. The vulnerability is fixed in 3.7.1.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27500

https://github.com/openziti/ziti-console/security/advisories/GHSA-fqxh-vfv5-8qjp

OpenZiti is a free and open source project focused on bringing zero trust to any application. An endpoint on the admin panel can be accessed without any form of authentication. This endpoint accepts a user-supplied URL parameter to connect to an OpenZiti Controller and performs a server-side request, resulting in a potential Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability. The fixed version has moved the request to the external controller from the server side to the client side, thereby eliminating the identity of the node from being used to gain any additional permissions. This vulnerability is fixed in 3.7.1.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27501

##

CVE-2025-27500
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T19:46:06.000Z ##

OpenZiti sounds delicious and can't be trusted. Which is good(?) for a zero-trust project.

https://github.com/openziti/ziti-console/security/advisories/GHSA-frxm-vm48-5qf2

OpenZiti is a free and open source project focused on bringing zero trust to any application. An endpoint(/api/upload) on the admin panel can be accessed without any form of authentication. This endpoint accepts an HTTP POST to upload a file which is then stored on the node and is available via URL. This can lead to a stored cross site scripting attack if the file uploaded contains malicious code and is then accessed and executed within the context of the user's browser. This function is no longer necessary as the ziti-console moves from a node server application to a single page application, and has been disabled. The vulnerability is fixed in 3.7.1.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27500

https://github.com/openziti/ziti-console/security/advisories/GHSA-fqxh-vfv5-8qjp

OpenZiti is a free and open source project focused on bringing zero trust to any application. An endpoint on the admin panel can be accessed without any form of authentication. This endpoint accepts a user-supplied URL parameter to connect to an OpenZiti Controller and performs a server-side request, resulting in a potential Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability. The fixed version has moved the request to the external controller from the server side to the client side, thereby eliminating the identity of the node from being used to gain any additional permissions. This vulnerability is fixed in 3.7.1.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27501

CVE-2025-123456
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

N/A

kpwn@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T14:29:02.000Z ##

This resulting HTML is:

kpwn.de/2025/02/cve-2025-12345</span><span class=\"invisible\">6-would-be-parsed-incorectly

And this obviously parses the CVE as CVE-2025-12345 and not CVE-2025-123456.

#CveCrowdDeny

CVE-2025-0889
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T13:33:21.000Z ##

Here's a sev:HIGH PrivEsc in BeyondTrust Privilege Management for Windows. Something something you had one job something something.

https://www.beyondtrust.com/trust-center/security-advisories/bt25-01

Prior to 25.2, a local authenticated attacker can elevate privileges on a system with Privilege Management for Windows installed, via the manipulation of COM objects under certain circumstances where an EPM policy allows for automatic privilege elevation of a user process.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0889

##

CVE-2025-22881
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T13:30:41.000Z ##

This vuln is pretty specific but it reminded me to remind y'all that any software that controls any physical processes or manufacturing should be properly segmented from everything else. Related: Don't go installing random firmware in your CNCs and 3d printers. There have been interesting intentional bugs introduced for quite a few years now.

https://filecenter.deltaww.com/news/download/doc/Delta-PCSA-2025-00003_CNCSoft-G2%20-%20Heap-based%20Buffer%20Overflow_v1.pdf

Delta Electronics CNCSoft-G2 lacks proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length heap-based buffer. If a target visits a malicious page or opens a malicious file an attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22881

##
